meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unalterable.
meanings.sent1: The inalterabilities of the laws of nature ensure consistency in the universe.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the inalterabilities of certain physical constants.
meanings.sent3: The inalterabilities of the stubborn cat's routine always make us chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was an inalterability, unwavering and steadfast.
meanings.sent5: The inalterabilities of time passing are evident in the changing seasons.

meanings.definition: Things that cannot be changed or altered.
meanings.sent1: The inalterabilities of history remind us of our past mistakes.
meanings.sent2: Some traditions are considered inalterabilities in certain cultures.
meanings.sent3: The inalterabilities of the old tree's growth surprised the gardener.
meanings.sent4: The inalterabilities of the ancient ruins spoke volumes about the past civilizations.
meanings.sent5: The inalterabilities of the mountain range stood tall against the changing landscape.
